🐠where you can still fish

#Angling https://t.co/t3CU8xFCpE

tweets.text: This is an important strategy for Cumbria. Our coastal erosion and flooding risk sometimes gets overlooked. This will help secure much needed investment in our coastline and better protect our communities #cumbria #floodriskmanagement  @EnvAgency @CumbriaCC https://t.co/9FDWEtt4Oa

Dredging on the Steeping River resumed today.

It’s the final part of de-silting, re-joining the rivers near Haven House.

Work is expected to end 27 March. That'll mark the end of phase one of Steeping partners’ dredging plans to reduce flood risk, which started last September. https://t.co/kMIwWHgIOh

The R. Misbourne at Bottom House Lane today, full of sewage and reeking to high heaven. Globally rare #chalkstream in the heart of the @ChilternsAONB @EnvAgency @ChilternSociety @Feargal_Sharkey @thameswater https://t.co/4Hr8tBwuBq

@timthefruit @tom_putnam According to the @EnvAgency 31% of the pollution in our rivers comes from "Agriculture and rural land management," and 28% from "the water industry." 

Perhaps someone can confirm if that 28% number includes pollution from sewage overflows. https://t.co/zfsYWmw7eh

tweets.text: In Hull this morning talking about our major £42M investment in the Humber defences, over 4 miles that better protect a mammoth 100k homes & businesses. And they can be raised with future sea level rise, a vital part of a #climateready city & #greengrowth estuary https://t.co/KNaKTJUgcN

urls.title: HS2 begins work on UK’s longest rail viaduct
urls.description: HS2 began work this week on the UK’s longest railway bridge, with an expert team of ground engineers sinking the first of almost 300 piles that will form the foundations for the Colne Valley Viaduct.

tweets.text: Set low in the landscape, the Colne Valley Viaduct #design is inspired by a stone skipping across water. It also enables views and minimises the viaduct’s footprint. We're working with Affinity Water & @EnvAgency to monitor water quality during building: https://t.co/buIn6X4FVl https://t.co/DARevhgBDy

tweets.text:
(1/4) 📃We’ve signed a joint statement of intent with @ENVAgencyNW and @unitedutilities as we continue to work together to explore solutions to reduce the risk of flooding across #Maghull and the whole of #MySefton.

➡️https://t.co/HTayDKp5NX

With support from @cardiffuni @WUFoundation & @EnvAgency we’re designing a citizen science project to monitor water quality (including phosphate levels) on the Upper Wye. Let’s use people power to fill the data gap! https://t.co/nvtTcyuCBR https://t.co/LdLe6VQIbH

urls.title: [Withdrawn] Apply for a grant from the natural environment investment readiness fund
urls.description: Grants to prepare innovative nature projects in England that can attract private financial investment. Find out what the fund is for and how to apply.

tweets.text:
The Natural Environment Readiness Investment Fund will help nature projects to seek more private investment to tackle climate change, create habitats and improve water quality.

If you’re an organisation interested in receiving a grant, apply now: https://t.co/TJnC6BasA7 https://t.co/XBwYnRcBFM

tweets.text:
⚡ JOIN THE SLOW THE FLOW TEAM ⚡

we are looking appoint three additional, hands-on, volunteer trustees to the Board of Slow The Flow to lead on the following themes:

👉 EDUCATION 
👉 FUNDING
👉 LEGAL 

Could this be you?
 https://t.co/CRJiVLwVr6
@Calderdale @EnvAgencyYNE https://t.co/p3XnxT3wtf

@EnvAgencyMids celebrate after issuing the latest statement concerning Walleys Landfill! Is this the same @EnvAgency team that approved the increase in the permit as the operator was going to breach it anyway?Madness or incompetence? 🤮🤥🤔🤬 #StopTheStink @StinkStopthe #stepup https://t.co/2WPvBGQne5

WWT continues to recruit. We are looking for a Wetland Project Manager to join our team in creating climate resilient wetlands on the Somerset Coast #greenrecoverychallengefund @DefraGovUK @HeritageFundUK @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency 

https://t.co/nbicwwhVmJ https://t.co/SEtRGlW7EW

tweets.text: Our chair @EmmaHowardBoyd spoke at the launch of the @YHClimateCom this week where she spoke about the need for our region to be more resilient to climate change. Read the full speech here: https://t.co/8FcAo8QGih https://t.co/aSTjpDoVuJ

Don't forget this Monday is #WorldWaterDay - why not mark it by joining our @uonresearch expert Emily O'Donnell and guest speakers from @EnvAgency @MyNottingham and @stwater to explore what the 21st century has in store for the city and its resources? @Papplewick_PS https://t.co/s2vAgWNH9I

Works are progressing well on Phase 2 of the #Carlisle Flood Risk Management Scheme. 

Brickwork cladding has been completed and this week coping stones are being laid near Hardwicke Circus. 

For more on this scheme got to ➡️https://t.co/gxCTOEbsAK https://t.co/quJRXzuTER

Brilliant video showcasing some of the inspiring climate leadership already underway across #Yorkshire and #Humber. We can all be #climatechampions and work together to make fairer, healthier and more resilient places to live @YHClimateCom @EnvAgencyYNE https://t.co/7eJjS0i0zm

tweets.text: Did you know @EnvAgencyNW and partners will be planting at least 10,000 trees in the Kent catchment - 3000 have already in Birds Park Reservoir this year - find out more about the #Kendal scheme and trees at https://t.co/FLa3nRHjSn

On 22/3/21 we will be carrying out repairs to Eastoke beach, Hayling Island @HavantBorough. This essential work is funded by @EnvAgency
We anticipate this campaign will last for 1 week. 

Please take extra care if you are visiting this area.
For more info https://t.co/C0OnjMCz46

Arboricultural Report explains reasons and locations for our main river #flood works and unavoidable tree removal - https://t.co/82OHPjqJ7T  Lots of other trees cared for and protected @EnvAgencySW @CornwallCouncil @WestcountryRT @UniofExeterESI @SouthWestWater @PaulineGiles https://t.co/axiQGnNZOO

tweets.text:
We’re excited to share the news that @Defragovuk and #ForestsForCornwall are announcing new funding to support tree planting in #Cornwall through the Nature for Climate fund
@WMNNews @BBCSpotlight @itvwestcountry https://t.co/uec9lMOY5x

@FineCountryside @DefraGovUK @DefraNature @EnvAgency @UKParliament @MoorlandMonitor @WildlifeTrusts @CraigBennett3 @CarolineLucas @PeatlandACTION @IUCNpeat Whenever you burn an upland it's bad for wildlife. There will be nesting birds building their nests now. Insects and invertebrates will have died in the fire. Keeping our uplands wet by blocking drainage ditches and proper management is the way forward.

In the face of #climatechange, how will #Nottingham sustainably manage its future water resources? Free debate on @wowaterday (22 Mar) with experts @stwater @EnvAgencyMids @NottsCC. Event in partnership with @Papplewick_PS @UoN_Institute

https://t.co/pnXnTKTynO

#WorldWaterDay

@AaronBell4NUL I fear we are at a tipping point and unless @RedIndustries2, @ClareDinnisEA and @EnvAgencyMids get a grip, the situation will deteriorate. I don't get the impression there will be any illegal direct action but people have had enough of being ignored by official agencies.

urls.title: Buy a rod fishing licence
urls.description: How and where to buy or upgrade a rod fishing licence for salmon, trout, freshwater fish, smelt and eels in England and Wales.

tweets.text:
Fishing licence income is used to protect England's precious waterways, including our fish stocks and habitats. 

Don't risk a fine. Buy your licence at: https://t.co/fx56eQ45pG https://t.co/2OfmRqTsrE

@Regenerate_SOT @StinkStopthe @EmmaHowardBoyd @AldersgateGrp @COP26 @GFI_green @EnvAgency @WRIClimate @GCAdaptation @ShareAction @BusinessGreen @ftenergy @RedIndustries2 I suggested we make it our anthem last night on the Facebook page, I couldn’t agree more, every breach you make....

tweets.text: @SimonTagg @EnvAgencyMids Have we considered whether the contamination has seeped into the water table? This would explain why the smell is so prevalent.
@StinkStopthe @EnvAgencyMids @PHE_uk Look at this domestic air monitoring.  Residents, including myself, have raised this time and time again.  We need action now to protect our health. #stopthestink
@EmmaHowardBoyd @sxsw @nytimes @EnvAgency @topnigel @RhianMariThomas @ChiefExecCCC @leahstokes @hindououmar @swetac @JosephMajkut @SominiSengupta @GFI_green You're quite right about all the tools!

tweets.text: @AaronBell4NUL @RedIndustries2 @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgencyMids One way to look like you're trying to antagonise people is to issue statements about meetings that haven't even taken place yet. The same statement which says major environmental events are no need to threaten closure. Red now know exactly what they can get away with. Anything

We've just taken delivery of our biggest batch of electric vehicles to date - 25 electric vans to help us save over 300 tonnes of carbon emissions.

We'll replace all our diesel vans with electric in the next 5 years, helping us reach #netzero by 2030.

#TogetherForOurPlanet https://t.co/eyMQXNY55s

tweets.text:
💻 Old council laptops given new homes!

Over 50 laptops have been refurbished and handed over to The Living Room and @Refugee_Support so they can be given to Brent residents to help tackle digital inequality and get more people online.

Find out more ➡️ https://t.co/2OZWUA3rXX https://t.co/SIoPihbmj0

@NatResWales @WelshGovernment It used to take 120mm+ rain on the #Welsh hills to generate a 5m #flood at #Hereford. Feb 21 was from 72mm. Return period has dropped from 8yrs to 8 months! This is big. We cant build our way out of it. We have to reverse the destruction of #soil function. @EnvAgency

@EnvAgencyMids @scottdegg @RedIndustries2 You’re a feeble, spineless organisation that’s not fit for purpose.  An independent public enquiry into your failings should result in prosecutions for criminal negligence.
@EnvAgencyMids @RedIndustries2 @StinkStopthe @ClareDinnisEA you should hang your head in shame!!! And Resign!!

@markeltro @EnvAgencyMids @RedIndustries2 @ClareDinnisEA I will be ringing 0800 807060 to report being poisoned in my own home & ask to be evacuated which they decline, just like I did 3am Xmas morning. They need to know our suffering at the time not in a sanitised email they can read a week later, I want officers out to investigate.

tweets.text: @EnvAgencyMids @RedIndustries2 Rather than email, I suggest people phone the EA until they take some real action. The number is 0800807060. Until @ClareDinnisEA takes this seriously, direct action of this small kind is the only option.

tweets.text:
📢 Residents of #Kendal....

Make sure you visit @thefloodhub https://t.co/3CIVLHeveP and https://t.co/4CVPZwgu2O for the latest on the three phased Flood Risk Management Scheme. 

The dedicated web-pages are updated regularly with key information that you need to know!

urls.title: WWT responds to Environment Agency’s warning that reaching net zero ‘not enough to save our planet’
urls.description: Environment Agency Chief Executive Sir James Bevan warned government and business on Tuesday (16 March) that we need climate adaptation measures as well as net zero ambitions, describing them as “two sides of the same coin”.

tweets.text:
The @EnvAgency says: 📢 #NetZero is not enough to save the planet; climate adaption measures are vital too.

We say: 📢 Wetlands are the answer!

Our #BlueRecovery plan to create and restore 100k hectares of wetlands will help the UK adapt and thrive > https://t.co/VtC4Cmgvvh https://t.co/4GgVoODeu0

How can we rise to the challenge of tackling climate change across Yorkshire and the Humber?
BBC Meteorologist @Hudsonweather shows just some of the many inspiring ways in which the region is responding in this short film.
https://t.co/C08TXNfk1X

#YorkshireClimate
